ca.uwaterloo.epad.prompting

Class PromptManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uwaterloo.epad.prompting.PromptManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class PromptManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class manages the prompts, determines when they should be displayed and controls their flow.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dmitry Pyryeskin
    See Also:
    PromptPopup

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent event)
      Listen to the events sent by drawers and the application and manage the prompts accordingly.
      static void addPrompt(PromptPopup pp)
      Add a prompt to the list of active prompts.
      static void draw()
      The draw loop calls the draw() method of every active prompt and also removes the prompts that exceeded their time to live and became invisible.
      static void init(processing.core.PApplet parent)
      Initialise the Prompt Manager.
      static void pause()
      Pause all timers and all active prompts.
      static void pre()
      This functions runs before a draw() function is called and manages the creation and the flow of prompts.
      static void reset()
      Reset the state of the Prompt Manager and the timers.
      static void resume()
      Resume all timers and all active prompts.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(processing.core.PApplet parent)
        Initialise the Prompt Manager. This function should be called after the GUI is loaded, but before any prompt is diplayed.
        Parameters:
        parent - parent applet

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Reset the state of the Prompt Manager and the timers. This function must be called after function init(PApplet).

      • pause

        public static void pause()
        Pause all timers and all active prompts.
        See Also:
        PromptPopup.pause(), Timer.pause()

      • resume

        public static void resume()
        Resume all timers and all active prompts.
        See Also:
        PromptPopup.resume(), Timer.resume()

      • addPrompt

        public static void addPrompt(PromptPopup pp)
        Add a prompt to the list of active prompts.
        Parameters:
        pp - a new prompt.

      • draw

        public static void draw()
        The draw loop calls the draw() method of every active prompt and also removes the prompts that exceeded their time to live and became invisible.
        See Also:
        PromptPopup.draw()

      • pre

        public static void pre()
        This functions runs before a draw() function is called and manages the creation and the flow of prompts.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent event)
        Listen to the events sent by drawers and the application and manage the prompts accordingly.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
